text: Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
parts of this tutorial.
Access Google Drive in your browser
by going to Drive.google.com.
To upload a file,

you can simply drag and drop
it into your browser window.

Alternatively, you can
click the "New" button
on the top left of the screen

and choose either "File
upload" or "Folder upload."

Use the "New" button here
to create a new file.

You can create different
types of Google Drive files,

such as documents,
spreadsheets, and presentations.

Choose the file type you
want from the drop-down here.
Give your file a name by renaming it here.
Any changes you want to make in the file

in the future will automatically
save on your drive.

You can organize your files
by using and creating folders.
To create a new folder,
click "New" and then "Folder."
Name your folder.

Add files to it by dragging
and dropping files.
To share a file or folder with others,
right-click on it and select "Share."

You can get a link to
share with collaborators
in the "Get link" section.

Add collaborators by inputting
their email addresses
and decide if they can edit, comment on,
or simply view the file.
You can add a personalized message here,
and then click "Send."
